meanings.definition: Burn slowly with smoke but no flame.
meanings.sent1: The campfire was smoldering after everyone had gone to bed.
meanings.sent2: The cigarette butt was still smoldering in the ashtray.
meanings.sent3: The smoldering embers in the fireplace looked like tiny glowing eyes.
meanings.sent4: His anger was like a smoldering fire, ready to burst into flames at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The smoldering ruins of the old barn were a haunting reminder of the past.

meanings.definition: Show or feel barely suppressed anger or other strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: She could feel her frustration smoldering beneath the surface.
meanings.sent2: His eyes were smoldering with resentment as he listened to the criticism.
meanings.sent3: The smoldering tension in the room was finally diffused with a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her smoldering jealousy towards her sister was evident in her passive-aggressive comments.
meanings.sent5: The smoldering rage in his voice made everyone stop and listen.
